meanings.definition: Showing excessive or unnecessary concern or attention to detail
meanings.sent1: She is the fussiest eater I know, always picking out every little piece of vegetable.
meanings.sent2: The cat was the fussiest of all, only drinking water from a crystal bowl.
meanings.sent3: The fussiest chef in town refused to cook unless all the ingredients were organic.
meanings.sent4: Her fussiest nature was like a magnifying glass, zooming in on the smallest imperfections.
meanings.sent5: His fussiest habits made him the talk of the neighborhood, with everyone knowing his quirks.

meanings.definition: Requiring a lot of attention or care
meanings.sent1: The newborn baby was the fussiest of all, needing constant feeding and diaper changes.
meanings.sent2: The antique clock was the fussiest item in the collection, requiring delicate handling.
meanings.sent3: The fussiest plant in the garden demanded daily watering and specific sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her fussiest possession was the fragile glass vase, needing protection from any bump.
meanings.sent5: The fussiest task of the day was caring for the injured bird, requiring gentle touch and patience.

meanings.definition: Being very particular or hard to please
meanings.sent1: He was the fussiest customer the shop had ever seen, inspecting every detail before purchase.
meanings.sent2: The princess was the fussiest of all, only accepting the finest silk for her gowns.
meanings.sent3: The fussiest guest at the party refused to sit anywhere except by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her fussiest critique was like a sharp knife, cutting through any flaws in the design.
meanings.sent5: The fussiest student in the class demanded perfection in every assignment, never settling for less.
